p: DR-UV-Vis spectra of the samples are shown in Fig. 14a. There is a blue-shift of the fundamental adsorption edge with increasing x in the (1- x)NaNbO 3– xCa 2Nb 2O 7 composition, excluding NCN0.25, which once again confirms the mobility of its structure being in a certain reconstructive transition between two structural families. Looking at spectral profiles, it comes clear, that NCN1.00 (Ca 2Nb 2O 7) is characterized by the strong adsorption in the UV region, peaking at 252 nm. The introduction of NaNbO 3 to the composition leads to the formation of the second component at lower frequencies. The separation of two components is the most distinct for both NCN0.10 and NCN0.25. Fitting with gaussians ( Fig. 14b) allows identifying two optical transitions bands at about 237 and 303 nm.
